name: Key West Marriott Beachside Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were 3 couples visiting Key West and had reserved one of the 3 bedroom/3 bathroom suites. The suite was very large and very clean. It had a top end kitchen and even a washer/dryer. Groceery stores are nearby. The hotel is about 10-15 minutes from busy Duval street, which is a good thing as it can be very noisy. You can drive into town or the hotel provides a shuttle service to & from the center BUT it is not always reliable; one night we had to take a taxi back and we were not pleased!
reviews.title: Perfect for our group

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no 'swimming' beach here, so beware. The pool area is very nice and clean and there are plenty of towels.
reviews.title: Great bar,great food,champagne on check in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a great place for a couples stay in Key West.
reviews.title: Nice but a little noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a suite and loved it. We had no view which was the only downer. Town is 3 miles away but every day we walked it for our am exercise. Beach chairs were available after 3. My husband lost his license and we were worried about getting home and he fortunately found it on the last day so pack the passport as a backup or copies of your license. Also the food in key west is fabulous.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, be cautious about the room you select

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at a newer (great) property- but this Marriott was far from Duval street and there was noise from the street traffic. There was additional noise from slamming of the heavy doors of the rooms. We did have a beautiful suite with a stunning view of the bay. Nice soaking tub and comfy bed and even a kitchenette! Staff seemed friendly and overall we got good service. (A litter of "Marriott" kittens were hanging out around the pool -begging for food and they were a huge hit with all the guests! Me especially!)
reviews.title: Worst resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Christmas 2011. Other reviews compliment the suites but the regular rooms are nicely appointed but quite small. B261 is opposite a linen closet/housekeeping station and doors slam and carts rumble like thunder on a morning you hoped to sleep in. Room shares a foyer and neighbors slam the common door often and early.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms, Noisy Neighbors and Maids

reviews.text: The entire property is actually a failed condo project, a victim of the South Florida housing bust (as per one of the employees, confirmed via Google) so there might be some bad juju at work. Staff is great, though. Just avoid those rooms near housekeeping.
reviews.title: Beautiful Suites but there are some downsides you should know before you book

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 2 BR suite at the hotel and it was gorgeous... nice full kitchen with Kitchen Aid and Sub Zero appliances and very comfortable bedding (2 kings).... however before you rush out and book you should know there are some downsides -- the hotel is more like a grouping of apartment buildings... with the lobby and restaurant a good 5 minute walk outside from some of the rooms. Only a few of the rooms actually look out on the water.. ours happened to allow us to stare directly into another set of buildings in the next door complex -- not good. You should call them and try to get the view you want when you book. Also -- the beach (as in Marriott Beachside) is not really a beach but rather trucked in sand and the area where you can enter the water is very small and would be crowded if 10 guests tried to get sun there. We weren't looking for that but you should be aware. Our biggest disappointment was the lack of wireless internet in the rooms. I'm ok paying for internet at a Marriott (I guess) but if you have a MacBook Air, IPAD, or Smartphone you'll be out of luck because they only have a wired ethernet connection. I asked about this and they said the buildings were hurricane proof so site-wide wireless was impossible although they do have it in the lobby building. I think for the price of the room, they could afford a simple router or mifi device in each room --- even if they wanted to charge a fee for use. It just doesn't make sense in todays technological age.... again if this matters to you then you might want to book where they do have wifi in the room -- we wanted to be able to check mail especially around the holiday season. The hotel is located on Key West just as you arrive on the island so it is easy to find. It is about 3 miles +/- from duval st and the tourist area.
reviews.title: One of the nicest suites I've ever stayed in

reviews.text: As I said the hotel has beautiful rooms... but when you get down to the details there are some things that might sway you away before booking.
reviews.title: Beautiful, spacious and relaxing!!

reviews.text: The Beachside suites we were upgraded to was one of the nicest I've ever stayed in. We surprised to have a full dining room and kitchen with subzero. The location is a bit off the beaten path but with the free shuttle to town and the airport all was well. We did have one glitch when we were moved from the hotel room after the first night to our suite my husbands brand new collared shirt went missing after we asked housekeeping to retrieve. I disappointment that left us a little uneasy and annoyed. If you're planning on spending time at the pool I would def snag a spot early and in the middle to enjoy the sun all day. There are watersports available on the property as well as a small but nice workout room. I'd def recommend the happy hour and tapas menu at the restaurant as well.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although there is no beach for swimming, you can rent jet skis and canoes for use on the bayside. at the hotel There is a hotel shuttle that drops off and picks up on Duval Street. This is great since parking is limited and pricey in the Downtown area. The pool was very nice and fortunately we had a breeze for part of our stay. Only had breakfast at the hotel which was very good. Recommend the snorkling tour with Fury. Bahia Honda State Park. is a nice day trip. Take a lunch and enjoy one of the few beaches in the keys.
reviews.title: Great Key West Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were really glad that we booked the suite at this Marriott. Had a full kitchen, one and one-half baths, dining and living areas separate from the bedroom and a washer/dryer. Had a balcony overlooking the pool. The accommodations were really comfortable. Could have stayed forever. It was a bit pricey for us, as we typically don't spend that much on hotel rooms, but we were able to cook a number of breakfasts and dinners, so that kept us out of restaurants. Would definitely consider a trip back!
reviews.title: Great stay in Key West!
"Amazing suites" does not do this place justice!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in the 1 bedroom suite with a resort view. The suites are exactly like the website. This resort was far more than what I excpected. We really enjoyed our time here.

Just returned from 4 nights at the Marriott Beachside and it was great...I booked a 1 bedroom suite but they upgraded me to a 3 bedroom/3bath Presidential suite...The room was beautiful,clean and spacious.The pool was very relaxing and the restaurant was awesome especially dinner.The staff was very helpful and friendly.The shuttle to Duval St was great but coming back every night we took a cab because it was very late..Sat night there was a fire in the hotel but that just made the trip more memorable....Would definetly go back
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 days for a business trip. The room I got was a suite and it was huge and very nice-- more like apartment that had 2 separate areas. One bedroom with full bath and the other living room and real kitchen with full dining table, subzero fridge, etc- way more than what one would expect. The floors were all nice travertine tile and very clean. The only downside was the shower had very low water pressure. This may have been an issue in just my room- not sure. They also have a complimentary shuttle that takes you downtown which is only a few minutes away.
reviews.title: Great suites!

reviews.text: I stayed here twice, once in September and once in December. One should note that this hotel is away from Duvall St and the center of action, but there is free shuttle service. I had my Platinum status recognized during both stays with free continental breakfast for the status. For my September stay, I had one of the better non-suite rooms that had a partial view of the pool. While the room was compact, I slept extremely well. For my December stay, I got upgraded to one of suites. The suite is gorgeous with a full stainless steel kitchen, a living room, a bedroom, and a bathroom with separate bath and shower. Unfortunately there was a strange intermittent noise outside of my room so I did not get a good night's rest. Fortunately it was only one night so I didn't make much fuss about the noise. All in all, I varying results with my stays but this Marriott does strive to be one of the better full service Marriotts out there.
reviews.title: Two Different Stays with Varying Results

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I celebrated New Year's in Miami and then went to Key West to continue the festivities. We stayed in the one bedroom suite and it was amazing! It is huge and luxurious! 6 seater dining, very high end kitchen, washer/dryer...hands down best room I've been in and I have been in a lot! The service was great as well, we had everything we needed. The location is a little away from Duval Street, but rent a scooter and take it to the street, which is a lot of fun or take the hourly shuttle. The "private beach" is nothing to write home about, but there are water sports on the property, which is a plus. The Ocean beach is a few miles away, we had a blast there! Not sure where the negative reviews are coming from, but from what I saw it was almost impeccable! I highly recommend it!
reviews.title: The right way to kick off 2012!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a lot of aspects of this hotel that I like. The king suite I had was great, overlooking the pool with a walk-down stairway so you did not have to walk to the elevator. It was fully equipped with a modern kitchen, had 2 flat screen TVs, a big bathroom with a spa tub and nice shower, and a roomy veranda. The location was fine for me, out of the noise and bustle of town, but with an hourly shuttle to take you there (with a great driver). Parking was good, underneath my unit. The pool and spa area was pleasant and well-kept, and there was a small private beach where you could get wave runners and other water equipment.
reviews.title: Acceptable, not great, but the service is not up to standard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where improvement is needed was in the service. We stayed a week, and had to call 3 days to get the room made up late in the afternoon. The restaurant, while lively both morning and evening, had staff that varied in friendliness, most good, but some look as if they forgot how to smile. The concierge did not consistently return phone calls.
reviews.title: Key West

reviews.text: If you book, make sure you get a suite (which most units are), since the regular rooms have no veranda and generally do not have a view.
reviews.title: Confirmied. WORST Marriott EVER

description: Key West Marriott Beachside Hotel is a seven-acre waterfront property with lush tropical gardens, magnificent waterfront swimming pool and a wide variety of unique dining experiences. It is a blend of island ambiance and contemporary elegance, set on the southernmost point of one of the world's most storied travel destinations.129 one, two and three bedroom suites plus 93 king standard rooms. Each suite has a gourmet kitchen with sub zero refrigerator freezer, living room, dinning room, spa tub in master bathroom, marble floors, balcony and washer dryer with resort or water views. The standard rooms are much smaller with one king bed and view of an open walkway.Our man made beach is for tanning with limited water access, we do have a water sports concession on property on the beach and a fishing pier.Our new WIFI service is complimentary through out the hotel including rooms and the pool area.
